main:
Instructional designers understand how people learn and use this knowledge to create solutions for specific learning goals.

In the next lesson, you’ll examine the theoretical foundations of Instructional Design, including:

  • the Information processing model, which describes how people learn
  • philosophies that underpin different approaches to instructional design
  • Gagne’s 9 Events of Instruction and other models for sequencing instruction
  • the importance of grounded instruction: making sure your designs have a basis in theory
  • your own personal philosophy about how people learn
